ranked_diseases.explanation: Plexiform neurofibroma is a hallmark feature of Neurofibromatosis type 1, and all similar reference cases with this feature were diagnosed as such.
While plexiform neurofibromas are more commonly associated with Neurofibromatosis type 1, they can also occur in Neurofibromatosis type 2, albeit less frequently.
Legius syndrome can present with some features overlapping with Neurofibromatosis type 1, including skin manifestations, but plexiform neurofibromas are rare in this condition.
Schwannomatosis involves multiple schwannomas, but plexiform neurofibromas are not typical, making this a less likely diagnosis.
